questions.question: Mia can sing beautifully, and ……………………..
questions.description: So can be used in the structure so + auxiliary verb + subject. This structure is used to add to the sentence before.

questions.question: I have never eaten …………………………. food in my life.
questions.description: We use so much before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: She has ………………………. children to take care of.
questions.description: We use so many before plural nouns.

questions.question: They held the ceremony on a Sunday …………………………… everybody would be able to attend.
questions.description: The structures so that and in order that are used to talk about purpose.

questions.question: Send the parcel express so that they ……………………….. it before Friday.
questions.description: After so that and in order that, we can use a present or future tense to refer to future.

questions.question: There are ………………………. children at the front door.
questions.description: We use some in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: You haven’t got ………………………… manners.
questions.description: We use any in questions and negative sentences.

questions.question: We met ………………………….. interesting people on holiday.
questions.description: We use some in affirmative clauses.

questions.question: ………………………… people want to go to the movies.
questions.description: We use some before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: …………………………… us want to go to the movies.
questions.description: Before a pronoun we use some of.

questions.question: There is little point in doing ………………………… more work now.
questions.description: Any can be used in affirmative clauses after words like little and hardly.

questions.question: There is somebody outside who ……………………………. to talk to you.
questions.description: Somebody usually refers to only one person.
